What is the cost of Measure L to taxpayers?

The previous bond from 1996 that funded the LHS Event Center has been paid over the past 24 years, so taxpayers will no longer be paying the $41 per $100,000 of the assessed value of their property each year. Lemoore Union High School District is looking for a few parents to serve on our Citizens’ Bond Oversight Committee. The Committee is responsible for informing the public concerning the District’s expenditure of bond funds as set forth in Prop 39, ensure that the Measure L expenditures are spent only on Measure L projects and that the money is not used for teacher or administrator salaries, and must present an annual report to the LUHSD Board of Trustees.

To be eligible for one of our three openings, you must meet one of these three criteria:

1) be both a parent or guardian of a child enrolled in the District and active in a school site council or parent-teacher organization,
2) be active in a bona-fide taxpayers association, or
3) be active in a business organization representing the business community located in the district.

Applications are available at the LUHSD, LHS, JHS, LMCHS and Lemoore Online offices.

The Lemoore Union High School District is seeking two members for its Citizens’ Bond Oversight Committee (CBOC). One position requires that the member be a member of a taxpayers association and the other position requires that the person must be involved with a business organization in Lemoore.

The duties of the CBOC are to 1) inform the public concerning the District’s expenditure of Measure L bond proceeds, 2) review expenditure reports produced by the District to ensure that they are only spent for Measure L purposes and are not used for teacher/administrator salaries, and 3) to present an annual written report for Measure L to the LUHSD Board.

If you have additional questions, please call (559) 924-6610 and ask for Superintendent Debbie Muro. If you are interested, you may pick up an application at the LUHSD office at 5 Powell Avenue or download the application on our website at www.LUHSD.k12.ca.us.
